Name: Yisel ("Luis Jesús") Mejías Silva
Description:
The victim was a sex worker.

"Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide" research project: En Torno Inteligente, 07.06.2010

Name: "Valdeci" Ferreira de Sousa
Description:
Valdeci died in hospital a day after being stabbed to death by their boyfriend Cristiano Pereira da Silva. The boyfriend was arrested after confessing that he murdered "Valdeci" after following an argument because of jealousy.

> The [trans person] and hairdresser Valdir Ferreira de Sousa was stabbed on Friday night (04) in Vila Irmã Dulce, south of Teresina. According to police, the main suspect is their partner, with whom they lived for approximately four years. They died last Saturday and only today (8) was their body taken to the Legal Medical Institute.
>
> The victim had been rescued by a neighbor who called Samu. The hairdresser was taken to the Teresina Emergency Hospital (HUT) but succumbed to their injuries and died less than 24 hours after being admitted to the hospital.
>
> The family believes the crime was motivated by a fight between the victim and their partner. “He was very aggressive, he already cut his nose once and even promised to kil them” Vera Lúcia said.
>
> Police officers from the 23rd Police District are already investigating the case and are looking for the suspect.

"Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide" research project: TV Canal 13, 08.06.2010

https://www.florianonews.com/noticias/pagina-137.html

Name: Fernanda Lavalle
Description:
Fernanda's body was found gagged and shot twice in the head after she had been missing for three days.

Fernanda was a sex worker and the president of the NGO Transgender Hidalgo, which declared that the killing was a hate crime.

"Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide" research project: El Financeiro, 22.06.2010, Notie Se, 24.06.2010

Name: Sandy Woulard
Description:
Sandy was found lying in the street. She died in hospital.

> It is estimated that one in 12 people who are transgender will die through violence in the United States. On the morning of June 21, Sandy Woulard—a resident of the 7700 block of South Ada—became such a person. Her body was found by a passing motorist near the corner of 75th and Halsted. Authorities report that Woulard died from a fatal gunshot wound to her chest leaving her dead at the scene.
>
> Chicago's transgender community has called for a response to local media coverage of Woulard's death, stating that references to Woulard in the Chicago Sun-Times as a "man dressed in women's clothing" are offensive and lack sensitivity to issues surrounding gender identity. The blogosphere lit up following Woulard's shooting with comments from members of the community offering various statements about the slaying.
>
> A blog for the transgender-advocacy organization Genderqueer Chicago featured a plea that members write to the Sun-Times and express their outrage over how the paper covered Woulard's death. Another online forum featured a brief goodbye letter to Woulard from someone who knows the victim and her family. But the overriding sentiment expressed by those in the transgender community and others who know Woulard, is that media treatment of people who are transgender is generally unpalatable.

"Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide" research project: Sun Times, 21.06.2010

https://pantagraph.com/news/state-and-regional/crime-and-courts/in-chicago-killings-of-transgender-women-of-color-often-go-unsolved/article_b1ee23ae-f8c9-11ec-9fbd-831f408380b8.html

https://www.windycitytimes.com/lgbt/LOCAL-NEWS-Transwomans-killing-stirs-community/27113.html

https://www.glaad.org/2010/11/19/transgender-day-of-remembrance-honoring-the-lives-lost

Name: Marcela Presley ("Marcelo Pedro" Justino)
Description:
The victim was a sex worker who was shot from a car when approached by a client. The murder took place on a beach, where the sex worker had been doing sex work for ten years.

"Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide" research project: Alagoas 24 horas, 01.07.2010 July 2010
